qas.question: Napoleon's master plan was to establish a French presence in what part of the world?
In 1806, what Ottoman ruler recognized Napoleon as Emperor?
In what year did Ottoman Emperor Selim III recognize Napoleon as Emperor?
Napoleon formed an alliance with the empire of which Persian ruler?
In what year did Napoleon's Franco-Persian alliance end?

context: Napoleon continued to entertain a grand scheme to establish a French presence in <a0_0>the Middle East<a0_0/> in order to put pressure on Britain and Russia, and perhaps form an alliance with the Ottoman Empire. In February <a2_0>1806<a2_0/>, Ottoman Emperor <a1_0>Selim III<a1_0/> finally recognized Napoleon as Emperor. He also opted for an alliance with France, calling France "our sincere and natural ally." That decision brought the Ottoman Empire into a losing war against Russia and Britain. A Franco-Persian alliance was also formed between Napoleon and the Persian Empire of <a3_0>Fat′h-Ali Shah Qajar<a3_0/>. It collapsed in <a4_0>1807<a4_0/>, when France and Russia themselves formed an unexpected alliance. In the end, Napoleon had made no effective alliances in the Middle East.
